column1: Context-Tree Recommendation vs Matrix-Factorization: Algorithm Selection and Live Users Evaluation
Stéphane Martin@École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne
column2: Boi Faltings@École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne
implementation and online evaluation of two e-commerce recommender systems developed with our partner company
column3: Prediggo. The first one is based on the novel method of Bayesian Variable-order Markov Modeling (BVMM). The second
column5: is a novel variant of the Matrix-Factorization technique (MF)
column6: which is considered state-of-the-art in the recommender literature.
